page.title: 03GLOUCESTER LANDSCAPE
page.content: LANDSCAPE AROUND THE SEVERN DOMESDAY BOOK RECORDS HEMPSTED VILLAGE WHICH SPRAWLS OVER A 30M. HIGH RIDGE BETWEEN THE CANAL AND SEVERN WHERE THE LOWLAND FLOODS WHEN HIGH TIDES MEET RIVER FLOODWATER SO 6 SQ.KM. OF BLOCK NO.03800216 IS MAINLY PASTURELAND WITHOUT AMENITIES. EAST OF THE SEVERN,LOWLAND IS BEING RAISED 20M. BY TIPPING RUBBISH - THIS MAY TAKE 20 YEARS. TREES ARE BEING PLANTED. SEWAGE WORKS ARE AT NETHERIDGE(RECORDED IN DOMESDAY BOOK). ACCESS TO AREA IS LIMITED BY LACK OF BRIDGES BUT A MAJOR ROAD BRIDGE COMPLEX COMPLETED IN 1984 PASSES 2KM. NORTH OF HEMPSTED OVER SEVERN. DURING EQUINOX HIGH TIDES PRODUCE BORES 3M. HIGH WHICH ATTRACT SPECTATORS. HEMPSTED CHURCH IS 10C.AND NAMED ST.SWITHUN.
